org.jcvi.jillion.internal.core.io

Class MagicNumberInputStream

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.io.InputStream
      • org.jcvi.jillion.internal.core.io.MagicNumberInputStream
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable

    public final class MagicNumberInputStream
extends InputStream
    MagicNumberInputStream is an InputStream implementation that reads ahead and saves the magic number so clients can determine a course of action by peeking at the magic number before they have to read any bytes from the inputStream.
    Author:
    dkatzel

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MagicNumberInputStream(File file)
      Convenience constructor which defaults to a magic number size of 4 bytes.
      MagicNumberInputStream(InputStream in)
      Convenience constructor which defaults to a magic number size of 4 bytes.
      MagicNumberInputStream(InputStream in, int sizeOfMagicNumber)
      Wraps the given InputStream and reads the first sizeOfMagicNumber bytes as the magic number.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MagicNumberInputStream

        public MagicNumberInputStream(InputStream in)
                       throws IOException
        Convenience constructor which defaults to a magic number size of 4 bytes. This is the same as new MagicNumberInputStream(in,4).
        Parameters:
        in - the InputStream to wrap.
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is a problem reading the inputStream for sizeOfMagicNumber bytes.
        See Also:
        MagicNumberInputStream(InputStream, int)

      • MagicNumberInputStream

        public MagicNumberInputStream(File file)
                       throws IOException
        Convenience constructor which defaults to a magic number size of 4 bytes.
        Parameters:
        file - the File to read as an InputStream.
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is a problem reading the inputStream for sizeOfMagicNumber bytes.
        See Also:
        MagicNumberInputStream(InputStream, int)

      • MagicNumberInputStream

        public MagicNumberInputStream(InputStream in,
                              int sizeOfMagicNumber)
                       throws IOException
        Wraps the given InputStream and reads the first sizeOfMagicNumber bytes as the magic number. Will block until the entire magic number has been read.
        Parameters:
        in - the InputStream to wrap.
        sizeOfMagicNumber - the number of bytes the magic number should be.
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is a problem reading the inputStream for sizeOfMagicNumber bytes.

    • Method Detail

      • peekMagicNumber

        public byte[] peekMagicNumber()
        Gets the entire magic number without advancing the InputStream. If the stream has already read past the magic number, it is cached for later retrieval.
        Returns:
        the magic number of this inputStream as a byte array.

      • read

        public int read()
         throws IOException
        Specified by:
        read in class InputStream
        Throws:
        IOException
